response.original_title: 新日本地理映画大系 東北の農村
response.overview: The farming villages that exist throughout  Tohoku are known for their rice production but struggle with cold-weather crop  damage. Many who rely on the single crop this land produces end up leaving their  villages to earn money. At the same time, innovative work has progressed with im-  proved adaptation of rice beds to the environment. The film also features people who  have cleared land for dairy farming and regions where large-scale land reclamation  projects have been undertaken.
response.title: The New Japanese Geography Film Series: Villages of the Northeast
